item.title: Report E-2025040503
item.description:
Report E-2025040503

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: PALM CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, thirty-six (36) pails of hydrochloric acid were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the asphalt and utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in four (4) 85-gallon overpacks and two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025040471
item.description:
Report E-2025040471

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CEVA FREIGHT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, at 1513 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by CEVA Logistic personnel in Miami, FL regarding the release of Aprosolve Methanol. The spill consisted of approximately 1 ounce of Aprosolve Methanol (UN1230, 3, II), which leaked from 1-5 gallon metal drum and impacted a concrete dock. CEVA personnel stated the consignee refused the freight. The damaged drum was returned to the terminal where they advised they will place the damaged drum, remaining waste inside, and oil-dri into a 55-gallon DF for disposal.

  • Description: On April 18, 2025, two (2) 5-gallon bladders of UN3267 were punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized soda ash and absorbents to remediate the trailer. All impacted materials and the damaged bladders were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report E-2025040466

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: ELKHART
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately twelve (12) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon poly drum due to a manufacturing defect at the bottom of the drum that resulted in the drum leaking. The released material impacted the concrete dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The damaged drum was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On April 17, 2025, one (1) 50-gallon cylinder of UN2401 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the site. The crew secured the valve, then utilized absorbent pads and cleaning agents. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 35-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040458
item.description:
Report E-2025040458

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a punctured 50-Gallon DM containing hazardous product, ROCRYL 410. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 20-gallon release onto the entire wooden trailer floor and concrete beneath the trailer in a 12 x 10 area as a result of a clamp puncture during the off-loading process. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and used absorbents pads to clean the trailer. One 85-gallon DF containing the overpacked damaged leaking was generated for waste disposal. One 55-gallon DM containing impacted oil dry and absorbent pads was generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.description:
Report X-2025041283

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-17
  • City: PINE BLUFF
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Upon notification I was conferenced in with Mr. Ainsworth, who reported that the hump crew found the car leaking in the bowl. Mechanical was contacted to assess and secure the door. Mechanical found the door partially open with a slow steady stream coming from the door. The door was secured, and the release stopped. Code 3 was contacted and responded and found multiple small piles on the bowl track. Track time was set up for 4/18/25 and two cubic yard bags was recovered by hand. LSB Industries has agreed to accept the collected material. The car is in HZ hold awaiting an OTMA-1 and then it will be shipped back to LSB in El Dorado.

item.title: Report X-2025041123
item.description:
Report X-2025041123

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/16/2025 at approximately 1745, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 832024 at the station location in Roseville, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box that contained two stuffed teddy bears and other Easter-themed decorations. The shipment was discovered by the K-9 unit during the location's screening procedure. Further investigation resulted in the discovery of a disassembled AR-15 rifle and a loaded magazine cartridge that was found inside one of the teddy bears. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA.

  • Description: On April 16, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1263 was punctured and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Mid-South Environmental Services (MSEs) to remediate the site. Crews deployed absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spend absorbents were collected and containerized into two (2) 55-gallon drums. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040454
item.description:
Report E-2025040454

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-16
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately three (3) quarts of material released from three (3) 1-quart metal cans from one (1) box due to a forklift accident that resulted in the cans being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The damaged containers were contained into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Description: On April 15, 2025, one (1) 6-gallon pail of UN1993 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. The damaged pail and impacted materials were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-15
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4/14/2025 at approximately 1745, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5105681 at the station location in Kansas City, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of two cans of paint packaged in a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered emitting a strong odor at the facility. Further investigation revealed that paint had spilled inside of its inner packaging and contained. The shipment was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings, labeling, packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an investigation by the FAA. All measurements mentioned in this report are estimated due to the missing information.

item.title: Report X-2025040969
item.description:
Report X-2025040969

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SUPERVISOR NOTIFIED RMP TO SEND A RESPONDER TO RESPOND TO A LEAKING HAZMAT INSIDE THE TRAILER. RESPONDER ARRVIED WITH FULL PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER NOTICED THAT THE LEAKING HAZMAT HAD A FLAMMABLE LIQUID LABEL. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. SINCE THERE WAS NO OUTSIDE SPILLAGE OF THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE, NO ZEP ZORBENT WAS NEEDED. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB AND HEADED BACK TO THE PSC CAGE. RESPONDER READ AND FOLLOWED CURRENT DISPOSAL FLOW CHART, WHICH LED THEM TO THE DMP PROCEDURE. RESPONDER STARTED PROCESSING THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID HAZMAT PACKAGE AND SOLIDIFIED ALL CONTENTS INTO GREEN BAGS. RESPONDER THEN DECONTAMINATED ALL PPE.

item.title: Report X-2025040970
item.description:
Report X-2025040970

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: FULLY LABELED HAZ-MAT SHIPMENT WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED WET IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING AN ALCOHOL-LIKE ODOR BY A SORTER ON BOXLINE-3. WITHOUT TOUCHING THE PKG HE NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR AND EVACUATED THE AREA. DMP WAS CONTACTED AND WITHIN 5 MINUTES A DESIGNATED RESPONDER ARRIVED, DONNING THE PROPER PPE AND WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. AFTER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET THE DAMAGE WAS CONTAINED (NO SPILLAGE OUTSIDE OF CARTON), THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP PROCESSING AREA. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 2 POLY 4-LITER CONTAINERS WAS LOOSE BY 1/4 ROTATION, CAUSING APROXIMATELY 6 OUNCES OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK THROUGH THE BREACH AND INTO A SIDEWALL OF THE CARTON. THERE WAS NO INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL AND THE OUTER CONTAINMENT WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT A 275 LBS PER SQ INCH BURSTING TEST.

item.title: Report X-2025041011
item.description:
Report X-2025041011

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS LEAKING. THE PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED FROM A FEEDER ONTO THE IRREGULAR CONVEYOR BELT WHEN THE LEAK WAS DISCOVERED. THE PACKAGE WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS ID8000 CONSUMER COMMODITY WITH AN APPROPRIATE SHIPPING PAPER, LTD QTY MARK, AND CLASS NINE DIAMOND LABEL. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS THERE ARE THREE X 500ML GLASS BOTTLES SET IN INDIVIDUALLY WHITE CARTONS SET INSIDE A LARGE ZIPLOC-TYPE POLY BAG. THERE ARE TEN X 100ML BOTTLES IN ANOTHER LARGE ZIPLOC-TYPE POLY BAG THAT DID NOT LEAK. THERE WAS WADDED CRAFT PAPER ABOVE AND BELOW THE BAGGED CARTONS. ALL INNER CARTONS AND POLY BAGS HAD BECOME SOILED BY THE COLOGNE AFTER ONE OF THE 500ML BOTTLES HAD SHATTERED. THE OUTER BOX APPEARED TO BE NEW OR LIKE-NEW 12 X 12 X 12 WITH A 44 ECT ON THE BOTTOM BOX SEAL.

item.title: Report X-2025041330
item.description:
Report X-2025041330

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-05
  • City: GARY
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: ILLINOIS CENTRAL RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 16000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 04-05-2025 a CN mechanical performing an inbound inspection of train M-34241-05 observed frost on the protective housing of tank car # SHPX 222262 along with a strong Propane type odor in the area. The employee notified the Dangerous Goods Team and made internal emergency notifications per the CN ERP. The CN Dangerous Goods Officer upon arrival and inspection found icing on the 2# B end liquid valve. It was found that the valve handle was not in the fully closed position. The plug was also found to be less than tool tight allowing product to leak out. The 2# Vapor valve was also found to be leaking due to the valve handle not being in the fully closed position and the securement plug was less than tool tight. Air monitoring readings on top of the car were below actionable levels with the highest LEL (Lower Explosive Limit) reading sitting at an 8%. PPE was FR Clothing and based on the Air monitoring readings on top of the car no raspatory protection was worn. Both the 2" B end liquid valve and vapor valve were closed stopping the release. The plug was removed allowing the residual product to vent and the valve to thaw. The securement was confirmed with an air monitor which showed non detect. The securement plug was then installed

item.description:
Report E-2025040467

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: WATERFORD TOWNSHIP
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) gallons of material released from two (2) 5-gallon metal pails due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails being crushed. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material, along with PPE, and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. One (1) 5-gallon poly drum was used to containerize the damaged pails. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freights contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040502
item.description:
Report E-2025040502

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-22
  • City: HAGERSTOWN
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: J. B. HUNT TRANSPORT SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 35000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two areas measuring approximately 50ft-by-10ft of the asphalt parking lot 20ft-by-5ft of the trailer floor and estimated that fifty (50) gallons of material was released due to hard brake incident that caused a load shift resulting in one (1) 55-gallon poly drum becoming crushed. First Call Environmental personnel deployed neutralizers to the impacted areas and then used a granular absorbent to recover the neutralized material. The remaining product in the damaged drum was neutralized and containerized along with the recovered spent material into eight (8) 55-gallon poly drums. The damaged empty drum was overpacked into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was transported offsite for disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 14, 2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2922 was punctured and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all impacted materials in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal. The damaged pail was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum as well.

item.description:
Report E-2025040333

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-14
  • City: ETNA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The drum was unloaded from the pick up unit and staged in preparation for transport to its destination. Shortly after staging, the operations supervisor discovered the leaking drum. After minimizing the spill, a small, pinhole sized leak was discovered on the bottom of the drum. The leak was active for about 30 minutes. The drum was placed in an overpack container and neutralizer was spread on the spill by HAZWOPER trained on site personnel. Once neutralized, the spill was cleaned up and packed into an overpack container in preparation for disposition.

  • Description: Driver was at a stop, turned on the PTO and noticed propane dripping from the bottom piping of the truck. Driver shut off the PTO, shut the belly valve, and moved the truck a safe distance from houses on a dirt road (Federal Hill Road). Fire department responded within 10 minutes and secured the site. EHS team came out to secure the leak and was able to drive the truck to an evacuation site in Concord, NH.

item.description:
Report E-2025040335

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-19
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2212 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BAT. It was reported that approximately 1-pound of " Chlorpyrifos" released from (2) plastic bags due to improper loading. The release impacted inside of trailer #3193654. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site due to googles being required; XPO felt comfortable cleaning up the spill. XPO will place the waste inside of a 55-galloon poly drum. ERTS generated waste ID 231097-1. ERTS notified Chemtrec, Esther provided report # 2025031900218.

  • City: BRIDGEVIEW

  • Description: At 1828 ERTS was notified by of XPO Logistics of a 1 cup release of BRAKE AND PARTS CLEANER from 2-5gal metal pails on the dock. The cause was due to a forklift accident. ERTS reviewed the SDS with terminal personnel who feel comfortable cleaning the release with proper PPE. Terminal personnel will place the waste into a 35gal metal drum in the facilities waste area. ERTS will update Titan and upload the SDS and waste label. As per the BOL, Chemtrec was notified Chelsey issued report 2025031700148.
